#Text=Wikinews interviews Australian wheelchair basketball coach Tom Kyle
#Text=Tuesday , July 1 , 2014
#Text=Toronto , Canada — What experiences makes a coach of an international sports team ?

#Text=Wikinews interviewed Tom Kyle , the coach of the Australia women 's national wheelchair basketball team , known as the Gliders , in Toronto for the 2014 Women 's World Wheelchair Basketball Championship .
#Text=Tom Kyle Image : Hawkeye7 .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=Tell us about yourself .
#Text=First of all , where were you born ?
#Text=Tom Kyle : I was born in Cooma , in the Snowy Mountains in New South Wales .
#Text=Way back in 1959 .
#Text=Fifteenth of June .
#Text=Grew up in the Snowy Mountains Scheme with my family .
#Text=At that stage my father worked for the Snowy scheme .
#Text=And started playing sport when I was very young .
#Text=I was a cricketer when I first started .
#Text=Then about the age of 12 , 13 I discovered basketball .
#Text=Because it had gotten too cold to do all the sports that I wanted to do , and we had a lot of rain one year , and decided then that for a couple of months that we 'd have a go at basketball .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=So you took up basketball .
#Text=When did you decide ... did you play for the clubs ?
#Text=Tom Kyle : I played for Cooma .
#Text=As a 14-year-old I represented them in the under-18s , and then as a 16-year-old I represented them in the senor men 's competition .
#Text=We played in Canberra as a regional district team .
#Text=At the age of 16 is when I first started coaching .
#Text=So I started coaching the under-14 rep sides before the age of 16 .
#Text=So I 'm coming up to my forty years of coaching .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) So you formed an ambition to be a coach at that time ?
#Text=Tom Kyle : Yeah , I liked the coaching .
#Text=Well I was dedicated to wanting to be a PE [ Physical Education ] teacher at school .
#Text=And in Year 12 I missed out by three marks of getting the scholarship that I needed .
#Text=I could n't go to university without a scholarship , and I missed out by three marks of getting in to PE .
#Text=So I had a choice of either doing a Bachelor of Arts and crossing over after year one , or go back and do Year 12 [ again ] .
#Text=Because of my sport in Cooma , because I played every sport there was , and my basketball started to become my love .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) } You still played cricket ?
#Text=Tom Kyle : Still played cricket .
#Text=Was captain of the ACT [ Australian Capital Territory ] in cricket at the age of 12 .
#Text=Went on to ... potentially I could have gone further but cricket became one of those sports where you spend all weekend , four afternoons a week ...
#Text=( ( WN ) ) I know what it 's like .
#Text=Tom Kyle : At that stage I was still an A grade cricketer in Cooma and playing in Canberra , and rugby league and rugby union , had a go at AFL [ Australian Football League ] , soccer .
#Text=Because in country towns you play everything .
#Text=Tennis on a Saturday .
#Text=Cricket or football on a Sunday .
#Text=That sort of stuff so ...
#Text=And then basketball through the week .
